front.title: YANG model for NETCONF Event Notifications

abstract.t: This document defines the YANG model for NETCONF Event Notifications. The definition of this YANG model allows the encoding of NETCONF Event Notifications in YANG compatible encodings such as YANG-JSON and YANG-CBOR.

note.title: Requirements Language

section.title: Introduction
section.t: This document defines a YANG data model for NETCONF Event Notifications . The notification structure defined in uses a XML Schema allowing to encode and validate the message in XML. Nevertheless, when the notification message is encoded using other encodings such as YANG-JSON or YANG-CBOR , a YANG model to validate or encode the message is necessary. This document extends , defining the NETCONF Event Notification structure in a YANG module.

section.title: Differences to draft-ietf-netconf-notification-messages
section.t: proposes a structure to send multiple notifications in a single message. Unlike , this document defines a YANG module to encode NETCONF Notifications with encodings other than XML, which is currently not existing. The structure for NETCONF notifications is defined in using a XSD, but there is no YANG module defining the structure of the notification message sent by a server when the message is encoded in YANG-JSON or YANG-CBOR .

section.title: YANG Module
section.t: The YANG module uses the same namespace from the XML Schema defined in Section 4 of allowing to use this YANG module to also validate already implemented XML encoded NETCONF Event Notifications.

figure.artwork:
<CODE BEGINS> file "ietf-notification@2023-07-23.yang"
module ietf-notification {
  yang-version 1.1;
  namespace "urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:netconf:notification:1.0";
  prefix inotif;
  import ietf-yang-types {
    prefix yang;
    reference
      "RFC 6991: Common YANG Data Types";
  }
  import ietf-yang-structure-ext {
    prefix sx;
    reference
      "RFC 8791: YANG Data Structure Extensions";
  }

  organization "IETF NETCONF (Network Configuration) Working Group";
  contact
    "WG Web:   <https://datatracker.ietf.org/group/netconf/>
     WG List:  <mailto:netconf@ietf.org>

     Authors:  Alex Huang Feng
               <mailto:alex.huang-feng@insa-lyon.fr>
               Pierre Francois
               <mailto:pierre.francois@insa-lyon.fr>
               Thomas Graf
               <mailto:thomas.graf@swisscom.com>
               Benoit Claise
               <mailto:benoit.claise@huawei.com>";

  description
    "Defines NETCONF Event Notification structure as defined in RFC5277.
    This YANG module uses the same namespace from the XML schema defined
    in Section 4 of RFC5277 to be able to validate already implemented 
    XML encoded messages.

    Copyright (c) 2023 IETF Trust and the persons identified as
    authors of the code.  All rights reserved.

    Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without
    modification, is permitted pursuant to, and subject to the license
    terms contained in, the Revised BSD License set forth in Section
    4.c of the IETF Trust's Legal Provisions Relating to IETF Documents
    (https://trustee.ietf.org/license-info).

    This version of this YANG module is part of RFC XXXX; see the RFC
    itself for full legal notices.";

  revision 2023-07-23 {
    description
      "First revision";
    reference
      "RFC XXXX: NETCONF Event Notification YANG";
  }

  sx:structure notification {
    leaf eventTime {
      type yang:date-and-time;
      mandatory true;
      description
        "The date and time the event was generated by the event source.
        This parameter is of type dateTime and compliant to [RFC3339].
        Implementations must support time zones.
        The leaf name in camel case matches the name of the XSD element
        defined in Section 4 of RFC5277.";
    }
  }
}
